title: Ticket #894: x86_rhas_3 binaries fail on x86_64_rhas_4 cross-test
description:
V7_4_0-branch-2009-10-18 and earlier worked.

V7_4_0-branch-2009-10-27 failed.

Between those two dates there were unrelated problems that caused all tests to be aborted.

Taking the V7_4_0-branch-2009-10-18 build (which previously passed) and running it on NMI's x86_64_rhas_4 machine now fails.

The tests fail because configure fails. Configure fails because it can't find libgcc_s.so.1 and libstdc++.so.5. Both are present, but in 64-bit versions, which aren't helpful.

Hypothesis: Something changed in the machine's configuration. Perhaps it was reimaged, or "unnecessary" 32-bit compatibility libraries were removed. I'm working with NMI to sort it out.
creator: adesmet
